image.altText: Allan Sumner has short dark hair, he wears glasses and a black jumper. He holds large bird feather, overlooking beaching solemnl

props.synopsis: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

title.children: 'A cultural emergency': First Nations groups detail effects of ongoing algal bloom

image.altText: A deer with antlers leaps over fence with dry pasture in background

props.synopsis: South Australia has ramped up its feral deer aerial culling program as drought-affected farmers battle the pest on their properties.

title.children: Environmental advocate warns feral deer will become Australia's next plague

image.altText: A young girl dressed in pink lays on the ground as her father draws around her with chalk.

props.synopsis: A state government body sat on a report into lead dust that was "poisoning" children for nearly four years and tried to keep its release quiet.

title.children: Australian children 'living in poison' with lead in bloodstream at high levels

image.altText: Three players looking dejected, two with hands on hips, one with hands on head, after losing semifinal

props.synopsis: After an eight-year AFL finals drought, the Adelaide Crows finished this year's home-and-away season as minor premiers — but the club's hopes were dashed by consecutive defeats that left the players and their fans wondering about what might have been.

title.children: The Crows are healing, Nicks says — but more cuts could be coming

image.altText: Aerial image of Andgar's Dublin piggery in South Australia taken by drone in June 2025.

props.synopsis: The Department of Primary Industries and Regions says about 200 animals died in the blaze while another 45 pigs were euthanised by the department and RSPCA.

title.children: Hundreds of pigs die after SA piggery catches fire

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: SA Police says it is investigating an employee's social media posts, after they allegedly made a post celebrating the assassination of the US right-wing political activist Charlie Kirk.

title.children: SA Police investigating social media post allegedly made by employee celebrating death of Charlie Kirk

image.altText: Susan Goodwin smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: SA Police and the Australian Federal Police (AFP) have launched a renewed investigation to find the remains of missing Port Lincoln woman, Susan Goodwin, who authorities believe was murdered.

title.children: SA Police and AFP launch renewed search for suspected murder victim in Port Lincoln

image.altText: An elderly man wearing glasses sits with fingers interlaced together over a table top

props.synopsis: A nursing home resident known to wander and ingest foreign objects died after choking on ribbons at a facility in Adelaide’s north, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Man 'choked to death' on ribbons and food in nursing home, inquest told

image.altText: A blue banded bee buzzes over a flower.

props.synopsis: A pollination ecologist says it is important people play their part in preserving native bees.

title.children: Residents encouraged to attract more bees as varroa mite spreads

image.altText: Two female students in grey uniforms look at a laptop on a table

props.synopsis: A ChatGPT-style app to be rolled out at all South Australian high schools next term has been welcomed by tech experts, who are also warning its use should be carefully managed.

title.children: AI app rolls out in SA schools as tech experts warn against 'dumbing down'

image.altText: The 'pass go' square on a monopoly game board.

props.synopsis: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?

title.children: SA government error in your favour — collect $1 million

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: The actions of a man who imported a child-like sex doll to his family home have been labelled "morally and legally repugnant" by a District Court judge.

title.children: Man jailed until at least 2028 for importing child-like sex doll

image.altText: A tractor and trucks piled high with belongings on a dirt road with blue sky

props.synopsis: Israeli troops encircle Gaza City as the UN chief slams the offensive as "systematic destruction", with thousands of Palestinians unable or unwilling to flee.

title.children: Israel 'burning' Gaza, defence chief says, as army deepens ground assault

image.altText: Tyler Robinson sitting emotionless in front of a white brick wall while wearing an armless green prison top

props.synopsis: Utah prosecutors say they will seek the death penalty for the 22-year-old alleged shooter.

title.children: 'Look under my keyboard': Charlie Kirk shooting suspect charged with murder

image.altText: A mine and train.

props.synopsis: One of Queensland's biggest coal miners says it does not want to see jobs lost but blamed "the Queensland government's unsustainable coal royalties and market conditions".

title.children: BHP alliance to sack 750 workers blaming Qld mining royalties

image.altText: Graphic of child looking at a screen with the logos of all social media companies with squiggles in the background.

props.synopsis: The social media saga has produced its fair share of intrigue. But the latest big reveal on how the ban will work has left us with just another cliffhanger.

title.children: We've been left with another cliffhanger on how the social media ban will work

image.altText: A close up of Sussan Ley.

props.synopsis: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

title.children: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The US president has been given something no other world leader has ever received: a second state visit invitation from Buckingham Palace. But assessing the trip's success means looking beneath the pomp and pageantry.

title.children: Royals have given Trump something no other world leader has received

image.altText: The words "FEDERAL RESERVE" engraved on a stone building.

props.synopsis: The world's largest central bank is less than 24 hours from announcing one of the most anticipated interest rate decisions of the year.

title.children: Federal Reserve stares down worst-case scenario: US economy in stagflation

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The expansion of the scheme, which allows first home buyers to purchase a property with as little as a 5 per cent deposit, has some warning it will also inflate the market. Here's what you'll need to be earning to get a foot in the door.

title.children: Here's who is eligible for an expanded first home scheme. Hint: it's not many

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has fallen after a negative session on Wall Street ahead of tomorrow's Federal Reserve decision, while BHP will sack 750 workers in its Queensland coal division. Follow live.

title.children: ASX falls ahead of Fed's rate cut as BHP axes 750 jobs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: US dollar stays near four-year lows
Pets in the cabin: Virgin Australia takes flight with furry passengers

image.altText: A red basket containing eggs, bread and mince, in a shopping aisle

props.synopsis: Disease-resistant pigs, faster-growing fish and heat-tolerant cows are among a new class of animals that are being genetically engineered for the dining table. Similar meat products could soon be sold in Australia without lengthy regulatory testing.

title.children: How gene-edited fish and meat are entering our food chains

image.altText: A man sits in an office with a pen in his mouth.

props.synopsis: Redford died "at his home in Sundance in the mountains of Utah" surrounded by family, his publicist announced.

title.children: Robert Redford, Oscar-winning Hollywood legend, dies aged 89

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Director of Public Prosecutions is considering whether to appeal a decision to allow a young fatal hit-and-run driver who bragged to his friends afterwards to avoid jail time.

title.children: Fatal hit-run driver condemned for bragging about running men down

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: About 400 educators were issued prohibition orders banning them from early education or care in the past five years, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Parents kept in the dark over hundreds of blacklisted childcare workers

image.altText: Customers browse items at David Jones

props.synopsis: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

title.children: What we know about Cashrewards's abrupt shutdown

image.altText: Mid shot of a farmer walking through waist high crop as the sun sets in the background

props.synopsis: Shifting growing seasons, interruptions to supply chains from increased natural disasters and damage to crops and livestock from extreme heat have been identified as key threats to food supply in a warmer climate.

title.children: Report exposes 'extremely concerning' risk to food supply as climate warms

image.altText: Jess Hull smiles with her medal

props.synopsis: Jess Hull claimed Australia's best result in a 1,500m at the world championships with a bronze medal, but she wants to make it gold next time around.

title.children: Relief for Hull as her career as The Hunted begins at world championships

image.altText: Two people sit on the couch looking serious.

props.synopsis: Residents and medical professionals in south-western NSW are pushing to establish a new local health district in Griffith, arguing current services are not good enough.

title.children: Rural doctors can't 'take it anymore', demand that health district splits

image.altText: a Rainbow Bee-Eater bird

props.synopsis: Conservationists say one of the country's largest colonies of a protected native bird is under threat at a two-day festival site.

title.children: Two-day festival to go ahead on protected bird's nesting site

image.altText: A man in a grey shirt and black cap stares at the camera

props.synopsis: Munda Station owner Mike Thompson says sourcing water for his animals is becoming increasingly challenging as pressure on the region's groundwater grows.

title.children: Pastoralist lends voice to growing concern over Pilbara water usage

image.altText: A man in a Fire Forest Management Victoria jacket standing in front of trees.

props.synopsis: Firefighters say they learnt a lot from the Black Summer bushfires, but fear Victorians have become complacent in preparations ahead of this fire season.

title.children: Black Summer efforts honoured as CFA warns against complacency

image.altText: Luigi Mangione, a man in his late 20s, walking in a prison jumpsuit, guided by two armed officers.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old Ivy League graduate still faces New York state second-degree murder charges and a federal death penalty prosecution.

title.children: Judge dismisses terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione

image.altText: Two police officers escorting a man.

props.synopsis: Two men will face court after police found $14 million worth of cocaine in a vehicle in Melbourne's north. It's alleged the men were transporting the cocaine for an illegal drug syndicate.

title.children: Police seize 40kg of cocaine in Melbourne bust

image.altText: A white post office.

props.synopsis: A rural Tasmanian community has fought to keep its post office open, fearing losing the important service could lead to their hometown disappearing.

title.children: How a tiny town brought its post office back from the brink of closure
